Contact book bloggers and pitch them your book for a review. Save your book in .pdf form so you can email it to the blogger. Make sure the blogger’s review goes up on your Amazon page as well as their blog. They may ask for a hard-copy book, which means the review won’t be “free,” but still, buy the postage and get the review.

In order to get in order to get book reviews you have to Market your book. As a self-publisher you have to put out request. There's an indie database online that you can go to and look up book reviewers. You have to go through this database and then send emails or follow the submission guidelines of these book reviewers. You can also look up you can also look up book bloggers and see if they will do a review for you.

Amazon, Goodreads, LibraryThing—there are no end of ways of accessing reviews to books and genres, just put a title and “review” into any search engine. There are also a myriad of blogs dedicated just to books and book reviews: again, judicious googling will give you pretty much anything you want.
